Reviews.Title: Good cable
Reviews.Author: Happy clam
Reviews.Content: First this cable has a high quality outer coating that makes it ideal for out side and weathered conditions. Second the 18 gauge wire is a must for any application that exceeds 60ft.Third if your going to go for the good cable don't go cheep with screw on BNC connectors. buy a good crimping tool and connectors. finely i won't do a security cameraproject with anything else. it just helps eliminates potential problems. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: No problems with it at all
Reviews.Author: D. Ballou
Reviews.Content: I needed to extend an existing CCTV run an additional 50' and used this wire for the additional cable run. No problems with any connections and do not notice any difference in video quality.

Reviews.Title: It's a professional grade cable.
Reviews.Author: John S. Gawaran
Reviews.Content: I like because it's high quality cable. I don't like it because it's very bulky since I have lots of cameras to install.

Reviews.Title: Good quality cable!
Reviews.Author: mary elisabeth kline
Reviews.Content: This cable was very easy to strip and install, due to the high quality coax!  I will definitely buy another roll once I get some more cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great cable for video
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Morgan
Reviews.Content: The product meets all of my needs for the project I am working on currently.  I am sure I will use this product in the future.

Reviews.Title: Shield braiding is not pure copper, it's copper clad aluminum
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: The description does not mention that the braiding is copper clad aluminum (CCA). Although it mentioned the center conductor is bare copper, which it is, but right next to it says 95% shield braiding making the reader thinks it's pure copper also. This cable is good if you run STANDARD DEFINITION CCTV cameras or on short runs. But I am installing a HIGH DEFINITION SDI system with a couple of long runs, so I want the cleanest possible video signal transmission to get the best possible image. I know this is very picky, but then it's why I got the HD cameras in the first place.Aluminum has a higher DC resistance than copper so for long runs the electrical signal will degrade a little. CCTV cameras run on BASEBAND frequency (below 50 Mhz) so the types of material has more effect than HIGH frequency bandwidth like CATV. This is another reason why it's not recommended to use RG6 for CCTV. The undesirable effect is ghosting or trailing images. If there was a mention of CCA braiding I would have past this up and won't waste my time reordering another cable.

ProductInfo.Features:
RG-59/U Type coax plus one pair 18 AWG stranded power cable. Siamese type configuration with separation web
Video Cable: 20AWG Solid Bare Copper Center Conductor, 95% Braid Shield
Power Cable: 2 x 18AWG (7 Strand) Bare Copper Conductor 300 feet in white color
Professional Siamese Coax Cable for CCTV Surveillance Camera and Security System
White PVC Jacket. Accepting Twist-on BNC Connectors or any other Standard RG-59 Coax Connectors and Power Pigtails
ProductInfo.Name: VideoSecu 300ft RG59/U Coaxial 18/2 Video Power Siamese Cable Wire Cord for CCTV Home DVR Security Surveillance Camera AA1
